lines.text: Don't look for a happy ending. It's not an American story. It's an Irish one.
[Referring to the men who shot Rory's father]
Did they catch the fuckers?
They were the fuckers.

I understand why he's doin' what he's doin'. If I had to endure what he's endured - -if I was eight years old and saw my father gunned down in front of my family - -I'd be carryin' a gun too, and I wouldn't be wearin' a badge.
What's the money for? I was thinkin' guns. I was thinkin' IRA.
I need that money Tom!
Why? So other eight-year-olds can watch their fathers gunned down in front of 'em? If this money leaves here, more people will die. Can you tell me that won't happen?
[last lines]
We never had choice... You and me.
The killing's got to stop, Frankie.
Then you'll have to kill to stop it. Get's a bit complicated, doesn't it?
When are you gonna let me drive?
I don't know, tomorrow.
You've been saying that for three years.
You're a stupid man, Mr. Burke. You only see me standing between you and your money. You're forgetting about the thousand men standing behind me. That's a mistake.
It's good to have somebody around here who can pee standing up.
[Looking at a dilapidated boat]
the Irish Republican Navy.
All the same, Mr. Fitzsimmoms, if you're not confused, you don't know what's goin' on.
They say the word peace, but at the end of the day, all they want is surrender.
Rory, are you married?
No.
You marry me?

[laughs]
I'll have to ask your dad first.
Hey Rory. You might wanna tell Sean about this.
Maybe I'll give him a call.
You could if he was home. But he's not home. You wanna see him? I know he wants to see you.
Go get the money and we can do the deal. There's a warehouse at 12th and 7th. I'll be waiting. And please don't fool around... or I'll kill your friend.
Stupid man!
We're in the police business, Eddie, not the revenge business.

[upset]
I've fired my gun four times on the street. Four times in 23 years.
Ya pick up a gun, sooner or later, someone gets a bullet.

[Rory inquires about Sean]
What do you think? You're gonna fuck with me? You bog-Irish hick! Fuck with me? I think not. You're own your own here, laddie. You know it... I know it... and I guarantee you, Sean knows it. Get him.
[Billy's thug retrieves Sean's head from car]
Fucking guns, man! These *fucking* guns!
[first lines]
How was your day?
It was a bit cold.
